# Onboarding Checklist

Use this checklist to onboard new contributors to the project. Customize the sections based on your project's specific needs and the new team member's role.

---

## Pre-Start (Before Day 1)
- [ ] Send welcome email with start date, time, and logistics
- [ ] Provision accounts and access (see Access & Accounts section below)
- [ ] Add to team communication channels (Slack, Teams, etc.)
- [ ] Assign an onboarding buddy/mentor
- [ ] Send calendar invites for first-week meetings

---

## Day 1: Welcome & Orientation

### Accounts & Access
- [ ] GitHub organization and repository access
- [ ] Project management tool (Jira, Azure Boards, etc.)
- [ ] Communication platforms (Slack, Teams, email lists)
- [ ] Document repositories (Confluence, SharePoint, etc.)
- [ ] CI/CD systems (if applicable)
- [ ] Development environment and tools (IDE licenses, VPN, etc.)
- [ ] Calendar access and meeting invites

### Key Documents to Read
- [ ] [Project Management Overview](../octoacme-project-management-overview.md)
- [ ] [Roles and Personas](../octoacme-roles-and-personas.md) - Review your assigned role
- [ ] [Project Planning guide](../octoacme-project-planning.md)
- [ ] Project README and contribution guidelines
- [ ] Code of conduct and team norms
- [ ] Current sprint/iteration goals
- [ ] Recent retrospective notes

### Introductions
- [ ] Meet with manager or project lead
- [ ] Meet with onboarding buddy/mentor
- [ ] Introduction to immediate team members
- [ ] Overview of project history and current state

---

## Week 1: Role-Specific Orientation

### For Developers
- [ ] Clone repositories and set up development environment
- [ ] Review coding standards and style guides
- [ ] Complete local build and run tests successfully
- [ ] Review architecture documentation and technical design docs
- [ ] Shadow pair programming session
- [ ] Review pull request process and branch strategy
- [ ] Identify a good "first issue" to work on

### For Product/Project Managers
- [ ] Review product roadmap and backlog
- [ ] Understand stakeholder landscape
- [ ] Review project charter and success metrics
- [ ] Access project dashboards and reporting tools
- [ ] Review risk register and current issues
- [ ] Attend sprint planning or project status meeting

### For QA/Testing Roles
- [ ] Review test strategy and test plans
- [ ] Set up test environments and tools
- [ ] Review bug tracking and triage process
- [ ] Understand acceptance criteria standards
- [ ] Review automation frameworks (if applicable)
- [ ] Shadow testing workflow for a feature

### For Other Roles
- [ ] Review role-specific documentation (see [role-responsibility template](role-responsibility-template.md))
- [ ] Identify key deliverables and current priorities
- [ ] Understand regular meetings and reporting cadence
- [ ] Set up role-specific tools and access

---

## Key Meetings to Attend

### Regular Meetings (add to calendar)
- [ ] Daily standup / team sync
- [ ] Sprint planning / iteration planning
- [ ] Sprint review / demo
- [ ] Sprint retrospective
- [ ] Weekly project status sync (if applicable)
- [ ] [Role-specific meetings based on your persona]

### First-Week Optional Meetings
- [ ] Architecture review or design discussion
- [ ] Stakeholder meeting or customer demo (as observer)
- [ ] Office hours or team Q&A session

---

## First 30 Days Goals

### Learning Goals
- [ ] Understand the project's purpose, goals, and success metrics
- [ ] Know who's who: team members, stakeholders, decision-makers
- [ ] Understand the full development/delivery lifecycle
- [ ] Become familiar with the codebase or product area
- [ ] Understand team processes (planning, reviews, releases)

### Contribution Goals
- [ ] Complete at least one meaningful contribution (code, doc, process improvement)
- [ ] Participate actively in team meetings
- [ ] Ask questions and provide fresh perspective
- [ ] Provide feedback on onboarding experience

---

## First 60 Days Goals

- [ ] Take ownership of a feature or work item from start to finish
- [ ] Participate in code reviews or design discussions
- [ ] Contribute to team documentation or process improvements
- [ ] Build relationships with cross-functional partners
- [ ] Understand escalation paths and how to unblock yourself

---

## First 90 Days Goals

- [ ] Demonstrate full proficiency in core role responsibilities
- [ ] Contribute to sprint/iteration planning and estimation
- [ ] Mentor or pair with another team member
- [ ] Identify and propose at least one improvement to team processes
- [ ] Complete onboarding feedback survey and share learnings

---

## Onboarding Feedback

### Check-in Schedule
- [ ] End of Week 1: Quick sync with manager and buddy
- [ ] End of Week 2: Review progress on first 30-day goals
- [ ] End of Month 1: Formal 30-day check-in
- [ ] End of Month 2: 60-day progress review
- [ ] End of Month 3: 90-day review and close onboarding phase

### Feedback Questions
- What went well during onboarding?
- What was confusing or could be improved?
- What resources were most helpful?
- What was missing that would have helped?
- How can we improve this checklist for the next person?

---

- Don't hesitate to ask - everyone was new once!

---

**Note:** This checklist should be reviewed and updated quarterly to ensure it stays current with team processes and tools.
